intro: Hoya sulawesiana, commonly known as the Sulawesi Wanda, is a species of flowering plant native to Indonesia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Hoya sulawesiana is a climbing plant that thrives in humid, shaded environments. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and unique floral display.
